column2: You and I, my boy, he turned to his son, "are left out in the cold."
column3: You and I, my boy, he turned to his son, "are left out in the cold."

column2: At this a scream, loud and terrible to hear, struck upon them all, as Joel flung himself flat on the floor.

column2: Isn't Jappy--our--cousin?	Isn't Jappy-our-cousin?

column2: I--want--Jappy!"

column2: Goodness! exclaimed the old gentleman, in the greatest alarm, "what is the matter with the boy!

column2: Do somebody stop him!"

column2: Joel, said Jasper, leaning over him, and trying to help Polly lift him up.

column2: I'll be your brother.

column2: That's best of all--brother to Polly, and Ben and the whole of you--then we'll see!"

column2: Joel bolted up at that, and began to smile through the tears running down the rosy face.

column2: Will you, really? he said, "just like Ben--and everything?"
column3: Will you, really? he said, "just like Ben-and everything?"

column2: I can't be as good as Ben, said Jappy, laughing, "but I'll be a real brother like him."

column2: Then I don't care!" cried Joel wiping off the last tear on the back of his chubby hand.
column3: Then I don't care!" cried joel wiping off the last tear on the back of his chubby hand.

column2: Now I guess we're better'n you, he exclaimed with a triumphant glance over at the little Whitneys, as he began to make the new shoes skip at a lively pace up and down the long room.
column3: Now I guess we're better'n you, he exclaimed with a triumphant glance over at the little Whitneys, as he began to make the new shoes skip at a lively pace up and down the long room.

column2: Oh, dear! they both cried in great distress.

column2: Make him be ours more, papa, do!"

column2: And then Polly sprang up.

column2: Oh! oh--deary me! And she rushed out into the hall and began to tug violently at the big bundle, tossed down in a corner.

column2: Cherry'll die--Cherry'll die! she cried, "do somebody help me off with the string!"

column2: But Polly already had it off by the time Jasper's knife was half out of his pocket, and was kneeling down on the floor scooping out a big handful of the seed.

column2: Don't hurry so, Polly, said Jasper, as she jumped up to fly up-stairs. "He's had some a perfect age--he's all right."
column3: Don't hurry so, Polly, said Jasper, as she jumped up to fly up stairs. "He's had some a perfect age-he's all right."

column2: What! said Polly, stopping so suddenly that two or three little seeds flew out of the outstretched hand and went dancing away to the foot of the stairs by themselves.
column3: What! said Polly, stopping so suddenly that two or three little seeds flew out of the outstretched hand and went dancing away to the foot of the stairs by themselves.

column2: Oh, I heard him scolding away there when I first came home, said Jasper, "so I just ran down a block or two, and got him some."
column3: Oh, I heard him scolding away there when I first came home, said Jasper, "so I just ran down a block or two, and got him some."

column2: Is that all there is in that big bundle? said Joel in a disappointed tone, who had followed with extreme curiosity to see its contents. "Phoo!--that's no fun--old bird-seed!"
column3: Is that all there is in that big bundle? said joel in a disappointed tone, who had followed with extreme curiosity to see its contents. "Phoo!--that's no fun-old bird seed!"

column2: I know, said Polly with a gay little laugh, pointing with the handful of seed into the library, "but I shouldn't have met the other big bundle if it hadn't have been for this, Joe!"
